about.title: About
about.text:
A young developer who studies on his own. During my studies, I have written many projects, the best of which can be found in the portfolio

I have completed many courses and continue to improve every day. I consider these facts about me to be the most important indicators:

During my studies at RS School, I was a team lead in all final projects. This speaks about my communication skills and ability to work in a team

My strengths are the ability to prioritize, and I also perfectly understand what is required of me and do it quickly

I always strive to learn something new and look for additional opportunities for professional growth. If you are interested in me, you know how to contact me ;)

Projects.1:
The final, team project of the RS School | React course. It is an analogue of the postman service

Here users can test various APIs (Restful and GraphQL). And all requests are saved in the local storage, for this you need to log in to your account, this is implemented using firebase

For Restful requests, it is possible to:

  • specify any url for the request
  • edit the body using a code editor with syntax highlighting and JSON format support
  • set request headers

For GraphQL requests:

  • Additional line for the url, with which you can get the graphql scheme
  • For the query request, there is a code editor with syntax highlighting. And after receiving the graphql schema, hints for autofill appear
  • For query variables, a similar code editor is used as for the body in Restful queries
Projects.2:
This is a project written in pure JS. It is an application for learning English by collecting cards from puzzles that are assembled into sentences

To start, the user must specify the first and last name to display this data on the home screen. All data is saved in local storage

The user goes through different levels, which have many rounds. As they progress, all completed levels are saved in local storage. When the user returns to the application, he can continue where he left off

The user is given a choice of hints, which, if desired, he can turn off:

  • Audio - recorded audio files with the pronunciation of a sentence
  • Images - puzzles become part of a large and famous picture. The game turns into assembling a puzzle from a picture, helping the user to correctly form sentences
  • Translation - each sentence has a Russian translation
